Pre-Game Insights: France's national football team are favourites for this tie despite failing to bounce back from their disastrous Euro 2024 campaign.
Belgium's national football team, meanwhile, secured a 3-1 win over Israel as Kevin de Bruyne's double helped the side to a perfect start to the Nations League campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two sides have faced off only 76 times in the past, with Belgium winning 30 of those games.
France have won only 27 ties between both sides, whereas the remaining 19 games ended in a draw.
Others: Kylian Mbappe's first game at the international level as a Real Madrid player ended in a disappointing 3-1 loss at home to Italy.
Real Madrid players Aurelien Tchouameni and Ferland Mendy withdrew from the French squad due to their respective injuries.
